title: Brennan Scarlett
text:
Brennan William Scarlett (born July 31, 1993) is an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="outside%20linebacker">outside linebacker</a> for the <a href="Miami%20Dolphins">Miami Dolphins</a> of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at both <a href="California%20Golden%20Bears%20football">California</a> and <a href="Stanford%20Cardinal%20football">Stanford</a>. He was signed by the <a href="Houston%20Texans">Houston Texans</a> as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> in 2016.
High school career.
Scarlett attended <a href="Central%20Catholic%20High%20School%20%28Portland%2C%20Oregon%29">Central Catholic High School</a> in <a href="Portland%2C%20Oregon">Portland, Oregon</a>. While there he <a href="Varsity%20letter">lettered</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a>, swimming and <a href="track%20%26amp%3B%20field">track & field</a>. In football, as a <a href="Tenth%20grade">sophomore</a>, he recorded 43 <a href="Tackle%20%28football%20move%29">tackles</a>, four <a href="Quarterback%20sacks">sacks</a> and three forced <a href="fumble">fumble</a>s. As a <a href="Eleventh%20grade">junior</a>, he recorded 59 <a href="Tackle%20%28football%20move%29">tackles</a>, six <a href="Quarterback%20sack">sacks</a>, one <a href="interception">interception</a> and three forced <a href="fumble">fumble</a>s. As a <a href="Twelfth%20grade">senior</a>, he recorded 31 tackles in the first two games of the season. He appeared in the 2010 <a href="U.S.%20Army%20All-American%20Bowl">U.S. Army All-American Bowl</a> and was named a 2010 "<a href="PrepStar">PrepStar</a>" All-American and SuperPrep All-American. He was also a National Federation of High School Awards for Excellence and a Multnomah Athletic Club Scholar Student Award recipient.
College career.
Scarlett then attended Cal. As a freshman in <a href="2011%20California%20Golden%20Bears%20football%20team">2011</a>, he appeared in three games. He recorded four tackles and 0.5 tackles-for-loss. He missed most of the season due to an injury. As a sophomore in <a href="2012%20California%20Golden%20Bears%20football%20team">2012</a>, he started all nine games he played. He recorded 40 tackles, six tackles-for-loss, 2.5 sacks and two forced fumbles. For the season he was named a <a href="Pac-12%20Conference">Pac-12</a> All-Academic honorable mention. As a junior in <a href="2013%20California%20Golden%20Bears%20football%20team">2013</a>, he missed the season due to an injury. As a senior in <a href="2014%20California%20Golden%20Bears%20football%20team">2014</a>, he again missed the majority of the season due to injury, only appearing in five games. For the season he was named All-Pac-12 fourth team by <a href="Phil%20Steele">Phil Steele</a>.
After graduating from Cal, Scarlett transferred to <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford University</a>, where he <a href="Major%20%28academic%29">majored</a> in management science and engineering, pursuing his <a href="master%27s%20degree">master's degree</a>. He became Stanford's first-ever graduate transfer. In his lone <a href="2015%20Stanford%20Cardinal%20football%20team">season</a> at Stanford, he appeared in 14 games. He recorded 37 tackles, eight tackles-for-loss, 5.5 sacks and two passes defensed. For the season, he was named All-Pac-12 honorable mention.
Professional career.
Houston Texans.
Scarlett went undrafted in the <a href="2016%20NFL%20Draft">2016 NFL Draft</a> and was signed by the <a href="Houston%20Texans">Houston Texans</a>. He was placed on <a href="injured%20reserve">injured reserve</a> on October 19, 2016, with a <a href="hamstring">hamstring</a> injury and was activated back to the active roster on December 17, 2016.
On December 4, 2017, Scarlett was placed on injured reserve.
In 2018, Scarlett played in 12 games before being placed on injured reserve on December 8, 2018 with an ankle injury.
On August 28, 2019, Scarlett signed a one-year contract extension with the Texans through 2020.
In week 9 against the <a href="Jacksonville%20Jaguars">Jacksonville Jaguars</a> in London, Scarlett recorded two sacks on <a href="Gardner%20Minshew">Gardner Minshew</a>, one of which was a strip sack that was recovered by teammate <a href="Dylan%20Cole%20%28American%20football%29">Dylan Cole</a> in the 26–3 win.
On November 9, 2020, Scarlett was placed on injured reserve. On December 19, 2020, Scarlett was activated off of injured reserve.
Miami Dolphins.
Scarlett signed with the <a href="Miami%20Dolphins">Miami Dolphins</a> on March 22, 2021. He was placed on injured reserve on November 23, 2021. He was activated on January 1, 2022.
